name: part0
text:
## Probability of Poker Hands ##

A hand in Texas Hold'em consists of 5 cards from a deck of 52 cards. A hand may fall into one of the following categories. We are going to compute the probability of each category.

First, the number of all possible hands is %s

name: part1
text:
### Pair: exactly one pair of equal rank cards ###

1. The number of possibilities for the ranks of the pair is %s

name: part2
text: 2. The number of possibilities for the suits of the pair is %s

name: part3
text: 3. The three other cards have three ranks different from the pair, the number of possibilities for their ranks is %s

name: part4
text: 4. And they can have any suit, thus the number of possibilities of their suites is %s

name: part5
text: 5. Thus the number of hands with exactly one pair is %s

name: part6
text: 6. The ratio of this number to the number of all hands %s
